instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3214: What is 820-3214? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3213: What is 820-3213? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> I/O Board
threads.message:
Hello Everyone, one my customer brought me an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board number with a spilled wine problem. Mainboard been cleaned and replaced with the needed parts. But we have some problems on I/O board too which has a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3214</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board number. Anywhere I can find boardview and schematic for it?

Thanks for your replies.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> I/O Board
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PYU74C9ZUz0NlQmfJGZcDPk7Sx4v7Twl/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Check if helps somehow.
No other schematic, or boardview available for LIO boards...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> I/O Board
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3213</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> available, similar to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3214</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but component placement is a little different.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> I/O Board
threads.message:
No idea why I didn't see it before on my PC...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/19xKUD1JvI2KFKt1WUl-mEzuKGq6tfvKh/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

You should be able to locate the points of interest, comparing 11-13" models.
Common failures are on <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> lines.
